title: Supreme Assembly (Parliament)
subtitle: Overview of the Oliy Majlis of the Republic of Uzbekistan
intro: The Oliy Majlis of the Republic of Uzbekistan is the highest representative body exercising legislative power. The Oliy Majlis consists of two chambers — the Legislative Chamber and the Senate — each serving a five-year term.
structureParagraph1: The Legislative Chamber is composed of 150 deputies elected in accordance with the law. The Senate is the chamber of territorial representation: senators are elected from the Republic of Karakalpakstan, regions and Tashkent city; additionally, 16 members of the Senate are appointed from among persons with significant achievements in science, art, literature, industry and other fields.
jointPowers:
Adoption and amendment of the Constitution
Passing of constitutional and ordinary laws
Deciding on holding a national referendum
Defining main directions of domestic and foreign policy and approving strategic state programs
Approving the State Budget and supervising its execution
Introducing taxes and other mandatory payments
Regulating administrative-territorial structure by law
Ratifying and denouncing international treaties
chamberPowersTitle: Exclusive Powers of the Legislative Chamber
chamberPowers:
Electing the Speaker and deputy speakers
Deciding on the removal of a deputy's immunity
Organizing the chamber's internal procedures
Making key decisions on political and socio-economic matters
senatePowers:
Electing the Chair and deputy chairs of the Senate
Approving appointments to the Constitutional and Supreme Courts upon the President's nomination
Confirming heads of the Central Bank, Prosecutor General and other officials upon the President's nomination
Considering and approving acts of amnesty
initiativeText: The right of legislative initiative belongs to the President, the Supreme Representative Body of Karakalpakstan, members of the Legislative Chamber, the Cabinet, the Constitutional Court, the Supreme Court, the Prosecutor General, and other subjects specified by law.
